death_place.zh-cn: 直隶省顺天府白米斜街
death_place.en: Baimi Xiejie, Shuntian Fu, Zhili Province

description.zh-cn: 晚清重臣，洋务派和清流派的主要代表人物。历任山西巡抚、两广总督、湖广总督、军机大臣等职，官至体仁阁大学士。倡导“中学为体，西学为用”，创办了汉阳铁厂等一系列近代工业和教育机构。与曾国藩、李鸿章、左宗棠并称“晚清四大名臣”。
description.en: A prominent official in the late Qing dynasty, a key representative of the Westernization Movement and the Qingliu school. He held various high-ranking positions including Governor of Shanxi, Viceroy of Liangguang, Viceroy of Huguang, and Grand Councilor, eventually rising to the rank of Grand Secretary of the Tiren Cabinet. He advocated for 'Chinese learning as the essence, Western learning for practical use' and founded a series of modern industrial and educational institutions, such as the Hanyang Ironworks. He is known as one of the 'Four Great Officials of the Late Qing' along with Zeng Guofan, Li Hongzhang, and Zuo Zongtang.

description.zh-cn: 晚清时期的重要政治人物，清文宗咸丰帝的妃子，清穆宗同治帝的生母。
description.en: An important political figure in the late Qing dynasty, consort of the Xianfeng Emperor and mother of the Tongzhi Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 晚清主张引进、仿造西方的科学技术，以“自强”、“求富”为口号，来维护清朝统治的官僚集团。
description.en: A bureaucratic faction in the late Qing dynasty that advocated for the introduction and imitation of Western science and technology under the slogans of 'self-strengthening' and 'seeking wealth' to maintain Qing rule.

description.zh-cn: 晚清时期的一个政治派别，以敢于弹劾权贵、作风清廉、言辞激烈著称。
description.en: A political faction in the late Qing dynasty known for its integrity, sharp criticism, and daring to impeach powerful officials.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代第一家官办钢铁企业，也是当时亚洲最大的钢铁厂。
description.en: China's first government-run iron and steel enterprise and the largest in Asia at the time.

description.zh-cn: 晚清时期由张之洞创办的现代兵工厂。
description.en: A modern arsenal founded by Zhang Zhidong during the late Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 晚清维新派人士，自立军起义的领导者。
description.en: A reformist in the late Qing dynasty and leader of the Self-Supporting Army Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 由唐才常等人组织的旨在“保驾勤王”、推行君主立宪的武装起义。
description.en: An armed uprising organized by Tang Caichang and others aimed at 'protecting the emperor' and establishing a constitutional monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 晚清重臣，湘军重要将领，曾任两江总督。
description.en: A prominent official in the late Qing dynasty, an important general of the Xiang Army, and former Viceroy of Liangjiang.

description.zh-cn: 义和团运动期间，中国东南各省督抚不理会清廷命令，与列强达成协议，以维护辖区和平稳定的一场政治运动。
description.en: During the Boxer Rebellion, a political movement where governors of southeastern provinces disregarded the Qing court's orders and reached an agreement with foreign powers to maintain peace and stability in their jurisdictions.

description.zh-cn: 晚清重臣，淮军和北洋水师的创始人和统帅、洋务运动的领袖之一。与曾国藩、张之洞、左宗棠并称“晚清四大名臣”。
description.en: A prominent official in the late Qing dynasty, founder and commander of the Huai Army and the Beiyang Fleet, and a leader of the Westernization Movement. Known as one of the 'Four Great Officials of the Late Qing' along with Zeng Guofan, Zhang Zhidong, and Zuo Zongtang.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末清朝与法国之间因越南宗主权问题爆发的战争。
description.en: A war in the late 19th century between the Qing dynasty and France over suzerainty in Vietnam.

description.zh-cn: 晚清时期的一位军事将领，因在中法战争中取得镇南关大捷而闻名。
description.en: A military general in the late Qing dynasty, famous for the victory at the Battle of Zhennan Pass during the Sino-French War.

description.zh-cn: 中法战争期间，清军在广西镇南关（今友谊关）一带击败法军的一场关键战役。
description.en: A key battle during the Sino-French War where Qing forces defeated the French army near Zhennan Pass (now Youyi Guan) in Guangxi.

description.zh-cn: 由张之洞奏请光绪帝创办的一所新式学堂，为武汉大学的前身。
description.en: A new-style school founded upon Zhang Zhidong's request to the Guangxu Emperor, and the predecessor of Wuhan University.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第十一位皇帝，在位期间发动了戊戌变法。
description.en: The eleventh emperor of the Qing dynasty, who initiated the Hundred Days' Reform during his reign.

description.zh-cn: 晚清末年和中华民国初年的重要军事及政治人物。
description.en: An important military and political figure in the late Qing dynasty and the early Republic of China.

en: Society for the Study of Self-Strengthening

description.zh-cn: 清末维新派在北京成立的政治团体，旨在推动变法维新。
description.en: A political group founded by reformists in Beijing during the late Qing dynasty to promote political reform and modernization.

description.zh-cn: 由张之洞撰写，系统阐述其“中学为体，西学为用”思想的著作。
description.en: A work written by Zhang Zhidong that systematically elaborates his idea of 'Chinese learning as the essence, Western learning for practical use'.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末在中国北方爆发的一场以“扶清灭洋”为口号的农民运动。
description.en: A peasant movement in northern China at the end of the 19th century with the slogan 'Support the Qing, exterminate the foreigners'.

description.zh-cn: 清末停止实行了一千三百多年的科举制度，推广新式学堂的重大教育改革。
description.en: A major educational reform in the late Qing dynasty that ended the 1,300-year-old imperial examination system and promoted new-style schools.

description.zh-cn: 清末由同盟会发动，在湖南、江西边界的萍乡、浏阳、醴陵地区爆发的武装起义。
description.en: An armed uprising launched by the Tongmenghui in the late Qing dynasty in the Pingxiang, Liuyang, and Liling areas on the border of Hunan and Jiangxi.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末代皇帝溥仪的生父，宣统年间的摄政王。
description.en: The biological father of Puyi, the last emperor of the Qing dynasty, and the Prince Regent during the Xuantong era.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代思想家、政治家、教育家、史学家、文学家，戊戌变法领袖之一。
description.en: A Chinese modern thinker, politician, educator, historian, and writer, one of the leaders of the Hundred Days' Reform.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命的伟大先行者，中华民国和中国国民党的缔造者。
description.en: A great pioneer of the modern democratic revolution in China, the founder of the Republic of China and the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国历史上的一场政治运动。
description.en: A political movement in the history of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命时期中国大陆的青年学生组成的群众性组织。
description.en: Mass organizations of young students in mainland China during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞的父亲。
description.en: Father of Zhang Zhidong.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞的从兄，清朝大臣。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong's cousin and an official of the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞的长子。
description.en: Eldest son of Zhang Zhidong.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞的幼子。
description.en: Youngest son of Zhang Zhidong.

description.zh-cn: 清末官员，戊戌六君子之一，张之洞的弟子。
description.en: An official in the late Qing dynasty, one of the Six Gentlemen of the Hundred Days' Reform, and a disciple of Zhang Zhidong.

description.zh-cn: 清末怪杰，精通多种语言，曾任张之洞幕僚。
description.en: An eccentric scholar in the late Qing dynasty, proficient in multiple languages, who served as an aide to Zhang Zhidong.

description.zh-cn: 清代古琴家，曾为张之洞的古琴老师。
description.en: A guqin master of the Qing dynasty who taught Zhang Zhidong.

description.zh-cn: 清朝在湖北和湖南地区的最高军政长官职位。
description.en: The highest-ranking civil and military position in the Huguang (Hubei and Hunan) region during the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清朝在广东和广西地区的最高军政长官职位。
description.en: The highest-ranking civil and military position in the Liangguang (Guangdong and Guangxi) region during the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清朝辅佐皇帝处理军国大政的最高核心官员职位。
description.en: The highest-ranking core official position in the Qing dynasty, assisting the emperor in handling major military and state affairs.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞是洋务派后期的主要代表人物。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong was a major representative figure of the Westernization Movement in its later stages.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞早年是清流派的健将。
description.en: In his early years, Zhang Zhidong was a stalwart of the Qingliu school.

description.zh-cn: 据说因为慈禧太后喜欢张之洞的文章，在其考中进士后破例提拔。后来又扶植他以抗衡湘军和淮军势力。
description.en: It is said that Empress Dowager Cixi appreciated Zhang Zhidong's writings and promoted him exceptionally after he passed the imperial examination. She later supported him to counterbalance the power of the Xiang and Huai armies.

description.zh-cn: 在担任湖广总督期间，张之洞创办了汉阳铁厂。
description.en: During his tenure as Viceroy of Huguang, Zhang Zhidong founded the Hanyang Ironworks.

description.zh-cn: 在督鄂期间，张之洞创办了湖北枪砲厂等重工业企业。
description.en: While governing Hubei, Zhang Zhidong founded heavy industrial enterprises such as the Hubei Arsenal.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞镇压了由唐才常等人领导的自立军起义。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong suppressed the Self-Supporting Army Uprising led by Tang Caichang and others.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞镇压了自立军起义并处决了其领导者唐才常。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong suppressed the Self-Supporting Army Uprising and executed its leader, Tang Caichang.

description.zh-cn: 在义和团运动期间，张之洞会同两江总督刘坤一与各国领事议订“东南互保”。两人后又于1901年联衔上奏推行新政。
description.en: During the Boxer Rebellion, Zhang Zhidong, together with Viceroy of Liangjiang Liu Kunyi, negotiated the 'Mutual Protection of Southeast China' with foreign consuls. They later jointly submitted a memorial in 1901 to implement new policies.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞是与刘坤一、李鸿章等人共同推动东南互保政策的核心人物之一。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong was one of the key figures, along with Liu Kunyi and Li Hongzhang, who promoted the policy of Mutual Protection of Southeast China.

description.zh-cn: 刘坤一是与张之洞、李鸿章等人共同推动东南互保政策的核心人物之一。
description.en: Liu Kunyi was one of the key figures, along with Zhang Zhidong and Li Hongzhang, who promoted the policy of Mutual Protection of Southeast China.

description.zh-cn: 文本记载张之洞对李鸿章似有成见，尤其不满其身后谥为文忠。
description.en: The text states that Zhang Zhidong seemed to hold a prejudice against Li Hongzhang, particularly being dissatisfied with Li's posthumous title 'Wenzhong'.

description.zh-cn: 1884年中法战争时，张之洞由山西巡抚升任两广总督。
description.en: During the Sino-French War in 1884, Zhang Zhidong was promoted from Governor of Shanxi to Viceroy of Liangguang.

description.zh-cn: 升任两广总督后，张之洞起用了退休老将冯子材以抵抗法军。
description.en: After being promoted to Viceroy of Liangguang, Zhang Zhidong re-employed the retired general Feng Zicai to resist the French forces.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞作为两广总督，支持并指挥了包括镇南关之役在内的对法军事行动。
description.en: As Viceroy of Liangguang, Zhang Zhidong supported and commanded military operations against the French, including the Battle of Zhennan Pass.

description.zh-cn: 1893年，时任湖广总督的张之洞奏请光绪帝创办自强学堂。
description.en: In 1893, Zhang Zhidong, then Viceroy of Huguang, petitioned the Guangxu Emperor to establish the Ziqiang Institute.

description.zh-cn: 在张之洞的奏请下，光绪帝批准创办了自强学堂。
description.en: At the request of Zhang Zhidong, the Guangxu Emperor approved the establishment of the Ziqiang Institute.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞与袁世凯、徐世昌等人都列名参加了强学会。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong, along with Yuan Shikai and Xu Shichang, was listed as a member of the Society for the Study of Self-Strengthening.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞曾出资赞助强学会。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong provided financial sponsorship to the Society for the Study of Self-Strengthening.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯与张之洞、徐世昌等人都列名参加了强学会。
description.en: Yuan Shikai, along with Zhang Zhidong and Xu Shichang, was listed as a member of the Society for the Study of Self-Strengthening.

description.zh-cn: 1898年，张之洞发表《劝学篇》，提出“旧学为体，新学为用”的思想。
description.en: In 1898, Zhang Zhidong published 'Exhortation to Study,' proposing the idea of 'Chinese learning as the essence, Western learning for practical use'.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞力主镇压义和团运动，并联合东南督抚实行东南自保。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong strongly advocated for the suppression of the Boxer Rebellion and joined with southeastern governors to implement the Mutual Protection of Southeast China.

description.zh-cn: 1905年9月2日，湖广总督张之洞与直隶总督袁世凯联名奏请立停科举，推广学堂。
description.en: On September 2, 1905, Viceroy of Huguang Zhang Zhidong and Viceroy of Zhili Yuan Shikai jointly submitted a memorial to immediately abolish the imperial examination system and promote modern schools.

description.zh-cn: 1905年9月2日，直隶总督袁世凯与湖广总督张之洞联名奏请立停科举，推广学堂。
description.en: On September 2, 1905, Viceroy of Zhili Yuan Shikai and Viceroy of Huguang Zhang Zhidong jointly submitted a memorial to immediately abolish the imperial examination system and promote modern schools.

description.zh-cn: 1906年12月，湖广总督张之洞派新军会剿萍浏醴起义军。
description.en: In December 1906, Viceroy of Huguang Zhang Zhidong dispatched the New Army to help suppress the Ping-Liu-Li Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 慈禧太后去世后，张之洞作为顾命大臣，力劝摄政王载沣不要杀袁世凯。
description.en: After the death of Empress Dowager Cixi, Zhang Zhidong, as a regent minister, strongly persuaded Prince Regent Zaifeng not to execute Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞与以康有为、梁启超为代表的激进改良派持有不同的政治主张。梁启超曾撰文批评张之洞“爱名爱身甚于爱国”。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong held different political views from the radical reformists represented by Kang Youwei and Liang Qichao. Liang Qichao once wrote an article criticizing Zhang for 'loving his reputation and himself more than his country'.

description.zh-cn: 1905年，张之洞认为留日学生风潮为革命党孙文煽动，电请各省督抚设法开导解散，以消除革命隐患。
description.en: In 1905, Zhang Zhidong believed that the student unrest among those studying in Japan was instigated by the revolutionary Sun Yat-sen, and he telegraphed provincial governors to find ways to persuade and disperse them to eliminate the threat of revolution.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞位于南皮县的原墓在文化大革命期间被毁。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong's original tomb in Nanpi County was destroyed during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 1966年，红卫兵刨开了张之洞的坟墓，并对其遗体进行了破坏。
description.en: In 1966, Red Guards dug up Zhang Zhidong's grave and desecrated his remains.

description.zh-cn: 张瑛是张之洞的父亲。
description.en: Zhang Ying was Zhang Zhidong's father.

description.zh-cn: 张之万是张之洞的从兄（堂兄）。
description.en: Zhang Zhiwan was Zhang Zhidong's paternal cousin.

description.zh-cn: 张权是张之洞的长子。
description.en: Zhang Quan was Zhang Zhidong's eldest son.

description.zh-cn: 张仁蠡是张之洞的幼子。
description.en: Zhang Renli was Zhang Zhidong's youngest son.

description.zh-cn: 戊戌六君子之一的杨锐是张之洞的得意弟子。
description.en: Yang Rui, one of the Six Gentlemen of the Hundred Days' Reform, was a favorite disciple of Zhang Zhidong.

description.zh-cn: 辜鸿铭曾担任张之洞的幕僚。
description.en: Gu Hongming once served as an aide to Zhang Zhidong.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞曾师从古琴家黄勉之学习古琴。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong studied the guqin under the tutelage of master Huang Mianzhi.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞在光绪十五年至光绪三十三年间，曾四度出任湖广总督。
description.en: Between 1889 and 1907, Zhang Zhidong served as the Viceroy of Huguang on four separate occasions.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞于光绪十年至十五年间担任两广总督。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong served as the Viceroy of Liangguang from 1884 to 1889.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞于光绪三十三年被任命为军机大臣，直至去世。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong was appointed as a Grand Councilor in 1907 and held the position until his death.
